article.name: A weekend-long journey into the EPFL universe
article.description: On 29 and 30 April, EPFL will invite the public to visit its Lausanne campus for two unforgettable days of discovery, experiments, workshops and talks.
article.headline: A weekend-long journey into the EPFL universe

article.name: Smart helmets to prevent head trauma
article.description: Players may not be aware of the severity of head impacts suffered during a game. Bearmind, an EPFL spin-off, has developed smart helmets that provide a series of metrics enabling coaches to...
article.headline: Smart helmets to prevent head trauma

article.name: New drug types can help counter antibiotic resistance
article.description: — EPFL scientists are developing a new approach that can help stem the tide of antibiotic resistance.
article.headline: New drug types can help counter antibiotic resistance

article.name: Magnon-based computation could signal computing paradigm shift
article.description: — Thanks to a breakthrough in the field of magnonics, EPFL researchers have sent and stored data using charge-free magnetic waves, rather than traditional electron flows. The discovery could...
article.headline: Magnon-based computation could signal computing paradigm shift

article.name: How genome doubling helps cancer develop
article.description: — Researchers at EPFL and UNIL have uncovered a new way in which cancer can develop: whole genome doubling (WGD) changes the way DNA is organized in the 3D space, leading to the activation...
article.headline: How genome doubling helps cancer develop

article.name: EPFL will train students on sustainability
article.description: — Starting fall 2024, all EPFL first-year students will be required to take a core class in sustainability, and each department will introduce a sustainability-oriented Bachelor’s class...
article.headline: EPFL will train students on sustainability

article.name: Art and the power of daylight
article.description: — Opening today, the new exhibition of EPFL Pavilions “Lighten Up! On Biology and Time” uses the lens of art to explore the connection of living organisms with the natural cycle of light...
article.headline: Art and the power of daylight

items.title: About ‐ EPFL
items.snippet: EPFL is Europe's most cosmopolitan technical university. It welcomes students, professors and collaborators of more than 120 nationalities.
items.htmlSnippet: EPFL is Europe's most cosmopolitan technical university. It welcomes students, professors and collaborators of more than 120 nationalities.

metatags.citation_title: The first ever photograph of light as both a particle and wave
metatags.twitter:title: The first ever photograph of light as both a particle and wave
metatags.og:title: The first ever photograph of light as both a particle and wave
metatags.og:description: Light behaves both as a particle and as a wave. Since the days of Einstein, scientists have been trying to directly observe both of these aspects of light at the same time. Now, scientists at EPFL have succeeded in capturing the first-ever snapshot of this dual behavior.
metatags.article:author: Nik Papageorgiou
metatags.twitter:description: Light behaves both as a particle and as a wave. Since the days of Einstein, scientists have been trying to directly observe both of these aspects of light at the same time. Now, scientists at EPFL have succeeded in capturing the first-ever snapshot of this dual behavior.

article.name: The first ever photograph of light as both a particle and wave
article.description: Quantum mechanics tells us that light can behave simultaneously as a particle and as a wave. However, there has never been an experiment able to capture both natures of light at the same time;...
article.headline: The first ever photograph of light as both a particle and wave

newsarticle.name: Chuong Ngo joined the Blanke Lab as postdoctoral researcher
newsarticle.description: Chuong will work on the project "The Home Within: Minimal Phenomenal Selfhood, Phenomenal Existence, and Meditation Neuroengineering".

newsarticle.name: Pavo Orepic interviewed by NYT for perception of one's own voice
newsarticle.description: In a new study published in Royal Society Open Science, Orepic and colleagues from LNCO showed that bone conduction improves recognition of one's own voice. The study garnered media attention.

newsarticle.name: Virtual Medicine Center launched at Geneva University Hospital (HUG)
newsarticle.description: Geneva University Hospital (HUG) launched Virtual Medicine Center aiming to bring VR/AR/MR technologies to the bedside for digital diagnostics and digital therapeutics.
